titleproper.value: Guide to the French Benevolent Society Records<lb/>1873-1976<lb/> <num>MS 233</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-06-28T13:47:50</date>

extent.value: in two document boxes and nine standing volumes

abstract.value: The French Benevolent Society records contain an array of fiscal reports, administrative minutes, deeds, insurance policies, correspondence, and record books that predominately relate to the French Hospital, however some documents focus on the Society.

p.value: The collection should be cited as: French Benevolent Society records, MS 233, New-York Historical Society.
Gift of Eugene Blanc and Ruth Granet, 1977.

The Society founded the French Hospital in 1881. The hospital was originally located at 131 East 14th Street in New York City, but later moved to 330 West 30th Street. The hospital housed 255 beds and employed 850 people. The hospital closed in 1977 due to financial problems.

The second box contains a volume titled "Reservistes Livre No.1." This volume appears to be a financial ledger, however, it is mostly written in French and therefore solidly establishing its true purpose has been difficult. A basic format was noted within this volume where each page states the name of an individual or family, a short biography of the person(s) is provided at the top, and the rest of the page is filled with dates and payments.

dsc.value:
Minutes of Meetings of the Board of Administration of the French Benevolent Society1873 March-1880 June This volume of minutes is handwritten in French.1Minutes of Meetings of the Board of Administration of the French Benevolent Society1880 October-1883 October This volume of minutes is handwritten in French.2Minutes of Meetings of the Board of Administration of the French Benevolent Society1893 November-1902 JuneThis volume of minutes is handwritten in French.3Minutes of Meetings of the Board of Administration of the French Benevolent Society1902 July-1914 October This volume of minutes is handwritten in French.4Minutes of Meetings of the Board of Administration of the French Benevolent Society1914 November-1923 October This volume is handwritten in French.5Minutes of Meetings of the Board of Administration of the French Benevolent Society1923 October-1932 September This volume is typed in French.6Minutes of Meetings of the Board of Administration of the French Benevolent Society1932 October-1937 DecemberThis volume is typed in English.7Minutes of Meetings of the Board of Administration of the French Benevolent Society1938 January-1945 December This volume is typed in English.8Minutes of Meetings of the Board of Administration of the French Benevolent Society1946 January-1953 December This volume is typed in English.9Warranty Deeds192611Scope and Contents

The following deeds to the French Benevolent Society can be found in this folder: Mary Wood, Adolph and Rose Goldner, Harry and Ada Hirschfield, Ethol Realty Company Inc, Anna Binsky, Bella Bellucci, Camillo and Orsola Gilardino, and Joseph R. and Helen L. Potter.

Deeds for Hospital Property (2 Folders)1904-196112a-bScope and Contents

The following materials can be found in folder a: survey maps of hospital property, French Benevolent Society (FBS) correspondence, receipt of funds notice from FBS to Bank, and legal correspondence with Delafield Marsh Porter and Hope. The following documents can be found in folder b: Emigrant Industrial Savings Bank Extension and Modification of Mortgages #16741, Contract of Sale between Hazkate Holding Corporation and French Benevolent Society, Warranty Deed from Albert Brown, Harry Brown, and Anna Brown, and Deed from Evelyn Mandeville, Caroline Mandeville Marks, and Henrietta Eliza Mandeville.

Deeds for Graves. Flushing Cemetery1941, 195713Scope and Contents

This folder contains several certificates from Flushing Cemetery Association and Kenisco Cemetery to the French Benevolent Society regarding received payment of $65 for graves.

 Woodlawn Cemetery Supporting Papers1931-193714Scope and Contents

The documents in this folder relate to Mrs. Louise Vizet, her grave/mausoleum allotment (#16899), and deed (#2963) at Woodlawn Cemetery. Documents include: a deed from Vizet to Woodlawn Cemetery, receipt of grave purchase and upkeep, and correspondence between Vizet and Woodlawn Cemetery.

Mortgage and Loan Agreements1917, 1920-1928, 1934-193515Scope and Contents

This folder contains numerous financial documents including: correspondence with the French Benevolent Society, bond and mortgage notices from Emigrant Industrial Savings Bank, Department of Finance tax document, extension of mortgage from Emigrant Industrial Savings Bank, and water bills.

Deeds - Cemetery Plots (Calvary, Greenwood, Rosehill, St. Michael's)1883 -194116Scope and Contents

Greenwood Cemetery Documents: Deed of Conveyance between Miss Maude Louise Troombly to Mr. Victor Vizet, Receipt of Conveyance between Miss Maude Louise Troombly to Mr. Victor Vizet, two Cast River National Bank Checks from Victor Vizet, memo describing Vizet papers, letter from French Hospital to Mr. Clarence A. Weill stating all documents related to Victor A. Vizet, Deed from Greenwood Cemetery to Miss Maud Louise Troombly. St. Michael's Cemetery Documents: license receipt from St. Michael's Cemetery for 3 residents, card of graves, and receipt of grave payment. Fairview Cemetery Documents: cemetery deed #1598 of plot payment ($20) for Albert Barbier, cemetery deed #1599 of plot payment ($25) for Albert Barbier, and note from Octave V. Monroy about Barbier graves. Calvary Cemetery Documents: grave deed for Mr. Vincent Fulchiron for Emma Marie Abel and Mollie McGrath Hale, correspondence between French Hospital Benevolent Society and Calvary and Allied Cemeteries regarding payment to maintain graves of Abel and Hale, permission to inter remains of Pierre Guillerm in free ground, and correspondence between Octave V. Monory and Vincent Fulchiron [French] Rosehill Cemetery: Single Grave Certificate

French Hospital Background Materials 1958-1976Most of the documents in this folder are written in English, however the "Histoire des Sciences Medicales" Journal is written in French.17Scope and Contents

The documents in this folder contain: Histoire des Sciences Medicales Journal, bibliography of materials relating to French Hospital exhibit displayed at NY Academy of Medicine, program cover for Bicentennial Exhibition at French Hospital, and centerfold providing history of French Hospital.

Reservistes, Livre No. 11914-1916The majority of this text is handwritten in French.2
